extendedIngredients.name: almonds
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup Simple Truth sliced natural almonds toasted

extendedIngredients.name: baby arugula
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 cups Simple Truth organic baby arugula to serve

extendedIngredients.name: chicken breast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces shredded cooked chicken breast such as Kroger rotisserie

recipes.title: Asian Chicken Salad with Toasted Almonds

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Toast natural almonds in a 350 oven until golden brown and fragrant, about 6-8 minutes; set aside.In a medium bowl, combine chicken, scallions, Sriracha, mayo and sesame. Using a fork, toss together until chicken is evenly coated.Serve over a bed of arugula and sprinkle with toasted almonds to serve.

steps.step: Toast natural almonds in a 350 oven until golden brown and fragrant, about 6-8 minutes; set aside.In a medium bowl, combine chicken, scallions, Sriracha, mayo and sesame. Using a fork, toss together until chicken is evenly coated.
Serve over a bed of arugula and sprinkle with toasted almonds to serve.
